Reviews.Title: “1930s/1940s Grand Hotel vibes ...”
Reviews.Author: MunichVagabond
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 days at the â€œExcelsior Lidoâ€� in April. It is certainly a hotel that has seen better days in the last decades. This place is literally the â€žcradleâ€œ of the Venice Film Festival since the 1930s and has still charisma. The architecture, large corridors and halls convey both a feeling of â€žancient grandeurâ€œ and (unfortunately also) â€žtristesseâ€œâ€¦ The Excelsior in winter would have provided a great film location for the movie â€žShiningâ€œ if the setting had taken place at the beachside instead of the mountainsâ€¦:-) The location: the Lido is significantly less touristy than Venice - at least during the tourist â€žhigh seasonâ€œ in spring and autumn. Hence, if you want to escape the tourist hordes, the Lido is a good location. The disadvantage is certainly to be dependent on boat transfers, but it didnâ€™t bother us too much as the public (water) transport system is very good. The Excelsior is 1,5 Km away from the water taxi station, but public buses go every 20 Min. from the hotel. â€žStrengthsâ€œ: â€¢ Unique feeling of sleeping in a room or bed, where Elizabeth Taylor, Clark Gable, Kirk Douglas or Paul Newman (just to name a few) have spend the nightâ€¦ â€¢ Free boot service to Plaza San Marco - 15 min. ride â€¢ Free Wifi and a beautiful beach-front terrace â€¢ Gym and nice possibility to go running or walking along the beach (southward direction) â€¢ Concierge gave us excellent restaurant recommendations â€¢ Room furniture and design is old-fashioned and something special (ancient fabric wallpaper, window frames and shutters with patinaâ€¦) â€“ certainly out-of-the-ordinaryâ€¦ â€žWeaknessesâ€œ: â€¢ â€¦ albeit not flawless: air-condition covered with dust, lights in the room not all working, worn carpets etc. If you expect an impeccable interior with modern facilities, do not go to the Excelsior... â€¢ Unfortunately neither indoor swimming pool nor wellness treatments (to be fair: this is very difficult to find in Veniceâ€¦) â€¢ Breakfast and service were as we would expect from a hotel in that price category; however the reception could be a bit more welcoming & smiling â€¢ Over-priced Given the price we would rate it 3 out of 5 in terms of value for money. It is not a hotel we would spend a longer holiday. Nevertheless we have to admit that it has some charm if you want to immerse yourself in â€œ1930s/1940s Grand Hotel vibesâ€� for a Venice weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice to get away from the hustle and bustle”
Reviews.Author: eibhlin031
Reviews.Content: I recommend this hotel if you are visiting Venice. Its nice to get away from the hustle and bustle and relax on the beach or take leisurely walks. The staff are very welcoming and chatty , the rooms are wonderfully large and decadent. The free shuttle boat taxi from the hotel to St Marks Square facilitates daily trips to the museums. A wonderful art deco style hotel on the beach, just a boat ride away from the tourist sights.

Reviews.Title: “The good, the bad and the down-right ugly”
Reviews.Author: dYquem
Reviews.Content: I am currently staying in the hotel. I will be here a total of ten nights. I rarely ever write a review during a trip, but am making an exception on this occasion. Before booking, (in addition of course to mandatory research on tripadvisor), I looked at the hotel's website. There was little in the way of room descriptions and no room pictures, which concerns me as it means the hotel can stick guests in a lower class of room than paid for, without the guest really knowing. Similarly, the standard legal notice (buried deep in a closet in the room, which I saw when putting my clothes away) did not specify the room type and merely said room prices varied from a minimum of â‚¬250 to a maximum of â‚¬1,050. Again, not very helpful (and not preventing the usual tricks). Despite this, the reviews were generally positive, so we booked. Vittorio, the hotel concierge, competently organised our transfer from the airport to the hotel. It consisted of a driver with a name card waiting for us in the arrivals area, helping us with all the luggage and taking us by car to the (very close) water taxi, and then the water taxi taking us to the canal-side entrance to the hotel. This was seamless and the staff very friendly and helpful (one of our group needed assistance getting in and out of the boat and car, and the staff were very helpful), albeit quite expensive (we paid â‚¬216 for four; the cost for two would have been â‚¬200). On entering the hotel, we were greeted by a bell-boy, and eventually found the way to the reception. The hotel facade and (newly decorated) lobby looked amazing. Similarly there is a fabulous (and apparently very famous) white-stucco ceiling reception room, which is breathtakingly beautiful. I read some of the reviews about the common areas being pretty poor - so I'm glad to report the massive improvement (albeit it does not extend to other parts of the hotel - see below). However, this did give me an expectation that the rooms would be similarly fantastic. When I arrived to the room (no-one came up with us to show us the room - which I expect from 5*L hotels), I was quite disappointed with the decor. The size was pretty nice (about 30' by 20' split into two parts by ugly columns, with a long narrow bathroom), but the decor was very 'tired' and made the room very dark. There was dust and dirt visible on some surfaces. Without wishing to sound excessively meledromatic, it looked like a 1970s Hilton. The bathroom was in a terrible state - rust was visible and not particularly clean. The bath was very narrow (which is odd as there was sufficient space for a much wider bath) and the shower needs desperately replacing with something more modern. There was awful water pressure and at about 6:30pm on more than one day, there was no hot water, which is totally inexcusable. I understand there will be a major bedroom refurbishment programme at the end of the season. It couldn't come too soon. Also, the housekeeping is not particularly thorough and they are certainly not 'efficient' - on some days the room was not cleaned until late afternoon. The main dining room (on the third floor with the amazing white stucco ceiling) is staffed by waiters who I pray are contractors rather than permanent. They are utterly incompetent and - with a few exceptions - are totally incomprehensible and did not listen and certainly could not speak English. They are not familiar with the day's menu. On more than one occasion, upon sitting down in the restaurant, it took up to 30 minutes for the waiter to even bring us the menu. 'Faulty Towers' comes to mind. I really liked the maitre'd (a chap called Baldo), who did his best to intervene when a problem is escalated to him (such as waiting an hour for a main course, only for one to arrive but not the others, and for it to go cold while the others took another 30 minutes to arrive) but the quality of the other staff was shocking and there is a limit to what one person can achieve. The waiters (except Baldo) should pretty much all be fired. Finally - and perhaps my biggest concern - is the total lack of visibility of senior hotel management. They don't really seem to care. I was told by some of the other guests that this is typical 'Venetian' behaviour. My feelings were shared by some of the other guests we met around the hotel. However, if you don't mind the above, and have little expectations of service once you're in the hotel, and don't expect to ever see a senior manager, you could do a lot worse. Sorry I can't be more positive than that.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Michelle N
Reviews.Content: I am extremely well travelled having stayed in 5 star hotels all over the world and this was the worst one ever. Besides the bar staff who were helpful, the concierge were condescending, the room was ok, the toilet was dirty on arrival, the bathroom was a joke for a 5 star hotel. The radiator wa covered in rust, hole in the wall above shower curtain. I will try and attach photos and all this for 5 Star prices, have stayed at other 5 star in Venice and there is just no comparison. Think very carefully before staying here.

Reviews.Title: “The most beautiful hotel in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: YvonneMF
Reviews.Content: We spent three days at the Excelsior on the Lido Island. This is the best hotel by far - elegant, full of history, right on the beach. Easy little boat ride to see all the sites. Loved every minute there!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel outside Venice Lido”
Reviews.Author: Amashir
Reviews.Content: Thatâ€™s a nice hotel with a classical European service. The only negative is that needs some point renovations and the noise of the boats running along if you open the window. Location - The hotel is located not far away from the city, providing free shuttle boats every 25 minutes (on time!!) to St Marks square. Rooms - luxury,spacious and comfort with a great laggon view. The bed linen did feel slightly damp; not sure if it was just the air con. The food was ok and very expensive..but we did find it difficult in general finding decent places to eat in Venice. Staff â€“ Very convenient and polite, mixing the a European old guard with a young team. Restaurants - I only took the breakfast. International, magnificent, and very assorted cuisine. Nice Blue Bar with a great service.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Naomi B
Reviews.Content: This hotel is placed right on the beach front at the Lido, a small stretch of land 15minute boat (vaporetto) ride from the Rialto. The Lido has everything you will need, long beach walks, shops ect and its so easy to get into Venice and the surrounding area from here, including Murrilio with the stunning glass blowers. Rooms are big and open with full sea views and the service was fantastic. Plus if you don't like the salty water of jelly fish the huge pool sits right out front almost on the beach anyway. I really enjoyed this holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Melancholia - the nice way”
Reviews.Author: solid_smile
Reviews.Content: I chose to travel to Venice in October and stay at the Excelsior with friend who also likes to splurge every now and than. It was just as quiet and wonderful like expected: after the deck chairs are removed and the noisy bars closed down along the beaches ot the Lido, the walk along the empty beaches in the soft autumn sun was just wonderful. The hotel interior has seen better days in terms of interior styling: a somewhat carelessly furnished lobby and hall is not the grand welcome one expects at such a place. But the sweeping view of the sea is there to make up for the disappointment. The rooms are really spacious and well equipped. Mine had a terrace with a marvellous view of the sea; my friend was disappointed with her "Venice view" which was almost not visible (it's too far away). Breakfast both from the buffet in the hall and served in the room (to be enjoyed on the terrace) was excellent. Venice itself was accessible quite easily. But one has to mind that the boat service provided by the Excelsior leaves only once per hour and the boat ride will take approx. 20 minutes. A nice thing to do while waiting for the missed boat in Venice... is to hang out in the Danieli lobby and bar - it's just accross the private jetty of the Excelsior and a perfectly nice place to enjoy a drink and snack. WLAN (at extra cost) was difficult to master for the iPhone 4. As for the airport transportation: we wouldn't book it via the hotel anymore. A person with a name tag will wait for you at the exit of the airport and accompany you to an ordinary water taxi at the extra charge of EUR 70,00.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel outside on Venice Lido”
Reviews.Author: atomic1111
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in Venice Lido, on the plus side it has a nice beach access, but on another hand it is a 15 minute boat ride away from the city (there are hotel boats every 30 minutes that will take you to the city center). There are a couple of restaurants near the hotel, but in general not much to do. Hotel looks impressive and beautiful from both the outside and the inside. Rooms are reasonable size and clean, but could use updating. Service was sufficient for our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Just not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: biggonhols
Reviews.Content: Poor view for expense of room. On honeymoon and ask for a view only to be offered a room with twin beds.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay if you want a bit of beach near Venice”
Reviews.Author: Gf0rce
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a quick boat ride away from Venice city. The hotel provides free boats every half hour to St Marks square. I think the last one is at midnight. The rooms are big and clean. The bed linen did feel slightly damp; not sure if it was just the air con. The food was ok and very expensive..but we did find it difficult in general finding decent places to eat in Venice. You can hire a cabana on the beach which gets raked and cleaned daily. The lido is a good place to stay if you want a beach holiday only 15 minutes boat ride away from Venice. Remember to take mosquito spray!

Reviews.Title: “Arrogant concierge”
Reviews.Author: Anjual
Reviews.Content: It's not my first stay at the hotel and I'm planing to come again. The hotel is nice, but requires rennovation. All the staff (at the reception, beach, bars) is friendly, except for the senior and oldest conÑ�ierge, who is very arrogant and unfirendly. He is behaving like "The King of the Hotel". He is very formal, never smiling and always speeking through clenched teeth. First of all the guests expect hospitality from the consierge service.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: albayady
Reviews.Content: My room's A.C was out of order for the first night and I had to sleep in a fan and it was really terrible, I changed my room next day and it was ok....

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but horrible management”
Reviews.Author: 5-6stars
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the excelsior for 3 nights on April 1st with my fiance. It was the first night the hotel was open for this season and since I stayed there several times over the year I was expecting it to be like always, but sadly I was very dissapointed. To start off there was no air condition in the room and it had 26 degrees that time. I contacted the manager and asked for compensation but all I was told is that they apologise and will cal me back. Now 3 months have passed and no one called. I dont think it right to pay the same for a room which is sold to be with AC like for a room which is hot I couldnt sleep. Like if I rent a car that says with AC I expect to pay less if it didnt work. Another point was that the pool was not filled up and again on the website, www.booking.com it said with pool. Also the breakfast are downstair on the beach was not yet set up. Although I love the Lido I was truelly disapointed about the managment. Sincerely,

Reviews.Title: “A grand hotel but...”
Reviews.Author: TorontoEh
Reviews.Content: The hotel is gorgeous as was our room and the public areas. The breakfast, which was included in the rate we booked on Venere, was probably the best we have ever had anywhere, with hot as well as cold dishes, and gorgeous fresh fruit. We stayed here because my husband was attending a conference at the conference centre nearby, so the hotel was fully booked. The staff at reception seemed overtaxed. I asked whether the room to which we had been assigned was quiet and the response was that we had a lovely view of the lagoon. Sounded good to us until we got there and realized that we would get all the noise of the boats and of the road running along that side of the hotel. We tried turning on the air conditioning to see if it would drown out the noise, but the air conditioning wasn't working. After trying to call the front desk, which didn't answer, back down we went to wait in line again. We were moved to a room over a quiet courtyard, and the room was spacious and elegant. We were also advised that the air conditioning was not turned on by law that regulates it's use in May and October in hotels, but they would send up a fan. We went to Venice on their free launch, which makes the hotel's location on the Lido manageable, and arrived back late to find the fan had not arrived. We thought we could manage without, but the room was very stuffy and our sleep was poor. Back we went the next morning to ask for our fan and advise them the curtains did not close completely and neither the sink nor bathtub stoppers worked. They promised me someone would fix everything as soon as they came to work at 9 am. Luckily I was in the room at 10 when someone arrived with the fan. I showed him the other problems, of which he seemed unaware, and he promised they would be fixed, which they then were. Minor quibbles, but not quite what I expect at a 5 star hotel. Nonetheless, I would certainly stay here again if I came to Venice with children or wanted a beach retreat, as pool and beach are lovely. I had an enjoyable walk to the Jewish cemetery on the other side of the Lido just past the ferry dock. If you walk along the path on the side opposite the water, you can see it through a locked gate in a red brick wall. If you turn back about a quarter of a block to the closest road, you ca see an arch and a flower stand outside the Catholic cemetery. Walk past the flowers stand to the arch and there is a bell to ring. This cemetery is unlike any Jewish cemetery I have ever seen, including the one in Ferrara. There are huge family monuments, one with a dome and alabaster windows, much like some of the churches. One person, born in the 1800s, was named Napoleon, after the man who liberated the Jews from the ghettos. I was reading the Garden of the Finzi- Contini, which is a perfect companion to a visit to Venice and refers to the cemetery.

Reviews.Title: “August idylls in one of the best hotels in Italy”
Reviews.Author: Robin_Saikia
Reviews.Content: I first visited the Excelsior nearly forty years ago - as a child - and I've returned here regularly over the years. On every visit - without fail - I still feel a huge sense of excitement and anticipation, a thoroughly seductive sense of glamour, hedonism, holiday and uplift. Lately I've taken to going over in August, a perfect time to visit the Excelsior for a quiet interlude of uninterrupted self-indulgence before the Venice Film Festival. For a couple of unhurried weeks it is easy to see why this was Winston Churchill's favourite hotel in Venice. The combination, unusual for his time and ours, of spatial grandeur and patrician informality never fails to inspire creativity and revitalise frayed nerves. The Excelsior goes from strength to strength under the management of Leone Jannuzzi and his team. Long may it last. The Lido is quiet in August, with very few foreign tourists in evidence. The beaches are populated by groups of impeccably behaved Italians enjoying a warm, temperate and peaceful Adriatic. Even with the pre-Festival hype, it is very nearly impossible to imagine this tranquillity being shattered in September as it is every year, when the Excelsior is packed to its minarets for a fortnight with stars, directors and their entourages. Excursions: A typical day in August might begin, as ours usually does, with an early morning walk or bicycle ride to Alberoni or San Nicolo, sufficiently bracing to appease the semi-dormant work ethic. The next step, when you've witnessed the sun rise and heard the dawn chorus, is a champagne breakfast at the Excelsior, a swim in either the sea or the pool and a stroll around the cluster of nearby art deco villas. Later the Tavernetta, the restaurant opposite the hotel, was sufficiently laid back last August for its owner to conjure up, after closing time, a late lunch of bruschetta and gnocchi. Afternoon tea at the golf club in Alberoni was entertaining, an agreeably eccentric amalgam of long-forgotten English, American and Italian values: ancient and unimpeachably shabby sofas and armchairs, cases of tarnished trophies, Ivy League-style honours boards, photos of the Duke of Windsor and Henry Ford - and distant but still unsettling reminders of Mussolini's meeting with Hitler here in the early Thirties. Back at the Lion's Bar, in the early evening, there was nobody about but a dazed-looking barefoot blonde, possibly the ghost of a Fellini extra, dancing slowly back and forth under a massive glitterball. Practicalities: the Excelsior has a luxurious and extremely useful motor-launch that plies to and fro from Venice - it's only 15 minutes to San Marco; the Excelsior's beach cabins are legendary - but if they're slightly out of budget then a sunbed and parasol are ideal (non-residents often opt for these and they cost about 100 Euros, something of a treat but well worth it for access to the immaculately-kept private beach); breakfast here is great - champagne, bacon and eggs and so on - I saw a charming vignette last year when, at breakfast, a solicitous member of staff invited in two very sedate, elderly nuns who were walking slowly along the beach to their convent - they stayed a while for coffee rather than champagne; the Blue Bar mixes great martinis; there is an excellent children's club offering well-organised activities in all weathers (there is a charming children's cabin in a discreet corner of the swimming pool area). This is without doubt one the best hotels in Italy, if not Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: GHammer84
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel twice before around 15 years ago when it was part of the Ciga hotel group. The difference between now and then was staggering. At its height this was a great hotel but sadly now I would rate it at best between a 3 and at a low 4 star. Everything about it is tired and the hotel desparately needs a facelift. The bathrooms are substandard with old shower curtains and worn out fixtures, the reception halls looked like they were geared more for conferences than luxury [there was a major Tupperware convention during our visit], and the hotel shuttle to and from Venice only ran hourly and not at all during lunch times. The tranfer to and from the airport is â‚¬140 each way. To top it all I booked ballet tickets at the Theatro di Fenice via the concierge who gave us the wrong start time so we missed the first act. The hotel management ir normal concierge service - ridiculous !!

Reviews.Title: “A 1950s time capsule.”
Reviews.Author: Gooserstein
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on a few nights ago as we traveled around Italy for our honeymoon. When we arrived, we both excited by the beautiful decor of the lobby and the views of the lagoon. My husband told the manager that it was our honeymoon to receive no reply. It was opening day and there was only about 4 couples in the entire hotel. We were not upgraded, like a few other reviewers. We did not receive anything in regards to our honeymoon. No one there seemed to care. We went to our room. What a shock. The walls are covered in nauseating drapery. The room had not been updated in more than 50 years. It was like a time capsule. It was very clean and in excellent condition but incredibly outdated. It even smelled like my grandparents home. I did appreciate housekeeping. They leave little treats on the bed when they turn it down. They even tucked in a stuffed bear I take with me when we travel. Very sweet. The breakfast in the AM was quite large, but the American foods I craved were not satisfying. The croissants, fruit, meat, and cheeses were yummy though. I guess when in Venice, eat like the Venetians. The vaporetto was beautiful. It picks up by the hotel Danielli under the Starwood dock. It's next to a taxi stand. In April it only runs every 2 hours. It picks up from San Marco at 13:30, 15:30, and so on. The ride was nice but I did get a little sea sick. As far as restaurants on Lido, there are several decently priced if you don't want to go back to Venice. Just exit the hotel, make a right and walk about 3/4 mile. They're near the ferry dock. The best in my opinion was right near the hotel. Make a right out of the hotel and a left onto the first street. It's on your right. It's a wine bar but serves delicious food. I had pumpkin ravioli with duck ragu. Mmmmm. Better than paying the steep cost of room service. Wines are very good too. The wine guy speaks English as well. All in all, we had a nice time in Lido. The hotel is exceptionally clean but in dire need of a remodel.

Reviews.Title: “The place for experiencing la dolce vita in style”
Reviews.Author: medartist
Reviews.Content: I recently had the pleasure of a two night stay at the Hotel Excelsior Lido in late October. I was talking to an Italian friend upon arrival, who told me that George Clooney and Elisabetta had been here in September for the Venice Film Fest. The free boat shuttle to Murano and to and from the Westin in Venice was a plus as well as the help received from the staff and concierge. Just remember that if Vittorio tells you that it's a ten-minute walk to the city center on the beach side, you need to add another twenty. Since it was the off-season, it was very quiet and relaxing, and we could only picture in our minds how active it would have been in the summer. The only minus to our stay was low water pressure in one of the bathroom sinks, but since there were two, we managed, and relayed the information to the front desk only as we were checking out. I highly recommend checking out the Lido center, and the charming bars and restaurants along via Lepanto.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay, in a great location, with a few down sides.”
Reviews.Author: pickymicky
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Excelsior for 4 nights this week. We were blessed with great weather which was a bonus for exploring Venice. As we approached the hotel for the first time â€“ using their free water shuttle that we boarded at the starwood jetty outside the Danieli Hotel â€“ we all gasped at the wonderful exterior of the building and the beautiful lagoon where the hotels private jetty is situated. We were helped off by the friendly captain, and walked into the hotel along the impressive red carpet corridor. We were disappointed to note that all the glass cabinets were empty and no paintings were hanging on the walls so the place felt a bit dead and hollow. The spa was closed, and the shops were too, and never opened whilst we were there. Perhaps gearing up for the close season prematurely. The reception was grand but again lacked some paintings/tapestries/decoration on the huge white washed walls. All the staff were very friendly and helpful and we were soon off to find our room. On entry my wife commented how lovely the room was, and it was of enormous size too. The bathroom had twin sinks and the bed was very comfy. We had a balcony that overlooked the sea, from which we noticed a big digger, pushing the sand up into a bank â€“ preparing for the winter storms. This added to the feel that the hotel was gearing up for the close season a bit early with rooms full of guests. We were spoiled by the hotel with a bottle of Prosecco and bowl of fruit, as it was our anniversary. A very kind and pleasingly accepted gesture. The prices of food and drink (as in most of Venice) are very expensive. A pint is 10 euros (Â£9!!!) A main course is about 35 euros (Â£32 for 1 course!) needless to say we ate out in restaurants (as we always do though to experience the citys nightlife) Venice is an extortionists paradise. One restaurant it was 18 euros for a pint of beer, 120 euros for an average bottle of prosecco and in another at lunch time we paid 12 euros for a sandwich and 8 euros for a cappuccino. My wife is Italian and we go to Italy a lot and this is by far the most expensive place we have visited. Breakfast was very good, a wide selection of fruit, pastries, cooked eggs/bacon, toast, meats, juices and the infamous complimentary prosecco. The cooked breakfast isnâ€™t all that- the bacon soggy and the eggs overcooked, but the selection available is wonderful. Overall the hotel was lovely if you can get it for a good price on a last minute website, but it is in no way a 5* hotel as advertised. I would say 3-4*s The rooms are excellent however, and the free shuttle service to and from Venice will save you a lot of money in taxi fares. The staff are friendly, the breakfast substantial and you get to stay away from the noise of the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “perfect nostalgic escape with an enchanting resort on your doorstep.”
Reviews.Author: Hessy
Reviews.Content: Having read previous reviews i was unsure what to expect. The Hotel was lovely but would rate it a 4 star not 5. Location was ideal to escape the hustle and bustle of venice town and the boat trip was an added bonus. Breakfast was good and helped to set us up for the day. Venice was an enchanting place , definately for lovers. Transfer from treveso airport was legnthy but easy enough to get the bus to the piazza Roma and the the waterbus to marco polo or direct to the lido and then a taki to the Hotel. Staff are a little starchy but generally no problem. On the whole any extras were expensive but thats to be expected. Rooms are spacious and clean. Would def recommend the hotel and venice , we enjoyed a fabulous short beak and loved the uniqueness of venice.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and unique property from a bygone era”
Reviews.Author: ConnellMaiorino
Reviews.Content: It's a unique property from another era. Attentive staff ( I used concierge services for wedding-related activities), attractive lobby and common areas. Our Deluxe room was generously sized and we were upgraded to ocean view (although the lagoon view may be preferable to some because it's possible to see Venice). We arrived as the off-season was beginning so weren't able to take advantage of the beach and related activities. Shuttles to Venice were on-time and the boat was spotless. We had a cocktail in the bar one night and it was the perfect way to wind down/end the evening after returning from Venice. Breakfast buffet (included) was ample, refreshed up until 10:00 am and included a variety of fresh fruits and cheeses in addition to standard buffet fare. I enjoyed prosecco with breakfast on some days, double cappuccino on others. It was a nice spot to come home to after spending time in Venice proper.

Reviews.Title: “Classic grand italian style hotel”
Reviews.Author: markq3
Reviews.Content: Grounds and location excellent for an out of but in Venice style holiday/break. In the summer we stay here or the San Clemente - the pool is better there - but here you have the beach. Bedrooms were large, elegant and gently dated (in a good way). Food was fine if a little pricey. It is what you would expect so 10 out of 10

Reviews.Title: “Grand In Every Sense”
Reviews.Author: BenLichfield
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at this hotel, very special from the boat ride out to walks along the beach. Staff excellent and cleanliness without question. A real treat!

Reviews.Title: “Family of 4 enjoyed our stay and would come back”
Reviews.Author: CanadianDad_10
Reviews.Content: It's good to come here with the right expectations. It's not a Four Seasons, it's not a 5 star with unparalleled service, but it is a nice, roomy hotel away from the St Mark's Square crowds with a cool nostalgic vibe and on the beach with a pool. We slept in a big King size bed with our 2 yr old and they brought in a free bed for our 9 yr old. I would come back. The free water taxi is a nice touch too. Here are some tips for you - 1. The free hotel water taxi leaves every 30 mins on the hour, but if it is high tide it leaves at 5 past and 35 past from the casino dock. They point up the street and tell you it's only 3 mins away but it is a bit tricky to find so best to give yourself a bit extra time to find the casino dock as there is no signage. You want to go left after walking a couple blocks. 2. If you are trying to find the free water taxi stand named St Mark's you have to go to St Mark's and then walk over a bridge and find the tiny stand along the water that says "Starwood". Hard to find at night. 3. I highly recommend the Guggenheim Museum. You can take the free hotel water taxi to Hotel Gritti and if you are too lazy to walk around, there is a little gondola service exactly outside the hotel that will take you across the canal for 50 cents - just look for the line of lazy people waiting. 4. You get free breakfast buffett at the hotel downstairs. I thought it was great! 5. You can take a hired water taxi to the airport. That will set you back 110 Euros. We took a cab to the dock in Lido (15 Euros), then the public water taxi (13 Euros each) and it took about an hour to get to the airport. Do the math if you have a party of 4 or more to see if it's worth it. I am sure you could get to the airport in about 30 mins in a water taxi. The line at security at the airport took about 45 mins the day we were there! 6. The taxis in Lido start at 7 or 10 Euros so a bit dear to take cabs in Lido. 7. The hotel has an awesome workout equip gym that was totally empty when I was there. 8. The bar has cool photos on the wall of Hollywood stars from the 50s. Female bartender was friendly. 9. Gondola rides in Venice are 100 Euros! Must be some union with a monopoly as they did not want to negotiate or budge off the price. We skipped it. 10.They have a business center, but they try to sell you a little time card. I told the reception person that all I wanted to do was print out my boarding pass and she gave me a free pass. The internet connection was slow and in the end I could not get to the website anyway. Good luck find the @ symbol on their keyboard. You have to hit a combination of keys to get it! 11. The further you venture from the maddening crowds at St Mark's square the better. Put the maps away and just walk and get lost and enjoy the uniqueness of the place. Have fun! We did.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon stay”
Reviews.Author: johnnyandlucy
Reviews.Content: We arrived to the Excelsior for the start of our honeymoon, we were upgraded to a suite and given complimentary Prosecco & strawberries which was a really nice touch. Our room was enormous with the largest bed, plenty of storage, and a wonderful balcony & sea view. The head barman was really friendly and helpful to us. The breakfast was excellent with plenty of variety and complementary prosecco. It was really nice to escape from the crowds in Venice during the day and lounge by the clean refreshing pool. The free boat from the hotel to St Mark's square ran every half-hourly and was a really pleasant way to see the city. We ate mostly out but ordered room service one evening, although expensive at 18 euros the club sandwich was the best I've ever had. So romantic, we would recommend this hotel without hesitiation, especially if you can avail of a good rate. Go and stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Tattered grand old dame, still charging like a sought after debutante and,now rude as well”
Reviews.Author: Nikohen
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at sister, Hotel des Bains many times. Closed now, I tried the Excelsior. Nice terrace light lunch $30 for tomato and mozzerella appetizer! Avoid the cabana unless you want to spend a few thousand for a week and be banished to the second row - no view of the beach! If you need wifi in the room -impossible. Wifi for a fee in the lobby if you are persistant enough to take the twenty minutes to sign on and patient enough to withstand the multiple crashes. Instead of the beach, we decide on the pool. Monday morning, the crew of constriuction workers arrived - tan, bare chested, fit and young (turned my wife's frown to a barely hidden grin). Sawing, hammering, drilling, they began to construct 7,000 square feet of semi permanent buildings. Later, I noticed that all of the airconditioning in the public areas was purposly turned off. Tuesday, without even a short apology, they dropped a few hundred feet of beams ten feet from our pool chairs and began construction - smoking, spitting, and total disregard of the guest never before experienced by me. When I enquired, without hesitation they offered to reduce our rate. And told us that they CLOSED the pool!! August on the Lido!! Of course they could do nothing about ruining the entire holiday, planned for months and not repeatable. They knew that construction was planned. They never informed us and basically stole our money and holiday. What was the wonderful elegant Excelsior is now a criminal.

Reviews.Title: “Kind of wierd with very mediocre service, but great location on the beach with pool”
Reviews.Author: GreatWallofChina
Reviews.Content: First of all this hotel is not a Westin/Starwoods hotel so don't expect that kind of consistent service. Secondly, I'm very mixed overall on this hotel; its old and not greatly kept up. The room decor is wierd and not that of a luxury hotel at all. We were wondering why the weird decor wasn't mentioned in any of the other reviews. The staff was adequate but not great. They were kind of the most dissappointing part of the hotel. They were helpful but it was like pulling teeth. The lady at the check-in, Francesca, was the epitomy of this. She wasn't mean or anything but not warm at all. We heard about her in some other reviews. The staff in general wasn't hospitable like you would expect from a luxury hotel. They would help you but it didn't really seem like they wanted to or enjoyed assisting. The rate we got for the room was okay but the restaurant, bar, and everything extra was a colossal ripoff. I also got some kind of scabie-like, mite infestation on my skin when staying there so that sucked. Positives: Free breakfast buffet was good, the pool situation was great. Clean pool, lots of lounge chairs and we went early July so it wasn't super crowded there; while it was super crowded in Venice. Not sure what we would've done if we stayed in Venice all day so the pool was a good situation to relax while it was really hot and crowded in Venice. Also, the free boat shuttle to Venice is clutch but without that this hotel would be just too inconvenient to Venice. Overall, we were glad we stayed there because it was away from the Venice crowds and the pool gave us a place to relax in the hot day but it looks like the hotel is resting on its beach location/movie festival location laurels. The other reviews for this hotel are way too high and you should temper your expectations if you plan on staying here. Not the full package you would expect from a luxury resort. Beach location, pool and boat shuttle to Venice slavage this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Grand Hotel, great option for a more leisurely trip to Venice!”
Reviews.Author: nemorino79
Reviews.Content: I already stayed at this hotel for a week in late May 2006 and returned for 8 nights in the second half of May 2010 knowing that the hotel ownership had changed. I am glad to report that the hotel is just as wonderful as it was, in particular the highly professional staff providing very individual service in spite of the size of the hotel: The concierges are top-notch, remembering your name and room number and providing great advice and recommendations. At the pool (which was a bit cool mid May but became warmer every day), as you indicate your preferred sunbed, the attendant will upholster it with a matress and three (!) towels. At breakfast, the waiter remembers your drink orders from the morning before etc. In short: true five-star service. We had a vast seaview room at the beginning of our stay and were then moved to a slightly smaller (still huge for Venice standards) lagoon-side room in the 6th floor with an unforgettable view over the lagoon, Venice and the snow-capped mountains in the back. Both rooms were decorated in the hotels signature moorish style and perfectly cleaned (twice daily maid service, towels being changed also on the occasion of turn-down service). It seemed to us that the season really only starts mid May, when the pool gets warm enough to swim in and when it's possible to have breakfast in the open-air restaurant at the beach and I believe that mid May to late June is the perfect time to come to this hotel. Also, by the end of May, the very efficient (and very memorable) complimentary motorboat-service to St. Mark's square (10/15 minutes ride) changes from an hourly to a half-hourly schedule and at the beginning of June, the hotel's private beach opens. As expected in a hotel of this class, the extras are very expensive (minibar, internet, room-service and food and drinks in general), but we perfectly managed to enjoy our stay without spending too much at the hotel - as mentioned, the concierges are happy to provide excellent recommendations for all budgets. A small point of critique: at breakfast, the orange juice dispensers don't look very elegant nor does the juice (from concentrate) taste very good. The waiters happily bring freshly squeezed juice on request though. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who has more than just a few days to spend in Venice and who wants to have a place to escape from the crowds in the center and spend some time relaxing at the beach or pool and we will definitely return, hopefully next spring.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous ..... We felt like film stars”
Reviews.Author: Hoodsy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights, June 2010 and felt just like the many film stars who have stayed here ....... The hotel is very grand without being intimidating. Rooms are large and well appointed, very clean and comfortable. Staff are very helpful and friendly. Breakfast is buffet with plenty to choose from including champagne. Around the hotel there are large seating areas both indoor and outdoor, a lovely swimming pool, gymnasium and a private beach although additional charges come into play on the beach. The big plus is the motor launch service to and from St Marks every hour until midnight. We stayed in the centre of Venice last year, saw all of the sights and this year decided on a more relaxing trip on the Lido but with easy access to the main area . Brilliant !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel we have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: SoniaandChris
Reviews.Content: This amazing Castle with friendly and impecible service offers huge rooms (by American standards) with delicious food. Great access from the Lido to Piazza San Marco via an exclusive hotel launch every 1/2 hour until midnight. The resort is on the Lido and has charm and sophistication and is a suitable venue for the Venice Film Festival and Chanel fashion parades. One feels like a movie star and is trreated like one as well. The Beachside pool provides welcome relaxation, far from the madding crowd. YOU HAVE TO INCLUDE A STAY HERE WHEN IN VENICE!!

Reviews.Title: “My favorite place in the world!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jpaScandanavia
Reviews.Content: I've been going tothe Excelsior now for 32 years every summer. It is really wonderful in everyway possible. Rooms are large and beautiful. Breakfast is great outside every morning. The beach is so nice to stay on during your days on the Lido. And the staff have always been great. It's my place to be in the summer. Thank you Excelsior. Can't wait to come back again in a few weeks!!!!

Reviews.Title: “enhance the pleasure of a visit to venice by staying at this grand hotel”
Reviews.Author: ontheroad078
Reviews.Content: we loved the excelsior. our room was huge and had two balconies overlooking the beach. the closets were perfectly arranged so that one could store everything for a long stay. the breakfast buffet was delightful and varied during the course of the week. although the beach is not open in april we walked along the sand anyway. we were surprised to find many beautiful seashells which made a great souvenier. riding the hotel launch to the city was fun and convenient. we enjoyed meeting other guests of the hotel on the launch. walk around the neighborhood of the hotel to see the lovely homes on the lido. the staff was especially helpful to us in advising us to get home when volcanic ash caused the venice airport to be closed. their advice and help saved us time and annoyance and we were able to catch our flight from rome to ny as scheduled. if you want the vacation of a life-time this is the place

Reviews.Title: “Most Unforgettable”
Reviews.Author: PattyM35
Reviews.Content: My visit to Venice was something extraordinary! My stay at the Westin was a beautiful surprise and everything was so enchanting! The service, the food, the suites. Everything was magnificent! I can't wait to go back again. The hotels' decor is in Murano glass and marble! For me it will be an unforgettable experience because that is where my husband proposed to me. He arranged a 15 minute show with fireworks right outside of the hotel. It was the only place in Venice that allowed Fireworks. Ilianna, the sales manager at the Westin made sure that our stay at the hotel was more than spectacular! I will remember my engagement more so than my wedding! That's how beautiful it was! Thank you everyone at the Westin Excelsior for making my visit to Venice so unforgettable!

Reviews.Title: “looks like an olden day castle!”
Reviews.Author: mbedi
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival to the hotel on our honeymoon stay we were upgraded to a partial sea-view room, .which was overall a nice room with a good size. the hotel itself was huge! however...very quiet and most of the times boring! you'd be lucky if you caught a glimpse of another soul besides the staff members. staff was somewhat helpful. be careful when ordering from the room service menu, make sure to clarify your order because if they don't understand english they will overcharge you! we ordered fries one night and the lady misunderstood, i ordered 1 plate she sent 2, which cost us 25 euros!!! that's almost $50 just on fries! they refused to take it back... :| anyhow, the buffet breakfast was good, the food was good, had a nice selection... the hotel had an outdoor pool, but they said it operates in june when the weather gets a bit better. also b/c of the weather no one used the beach..so if you go before june, good luck..there's not much to do! all u get is a nice view and a the very helpful watertaxi to st. mark's! OVERALL - our stay was nice b/c venice itself is beautiful, aside from the expensive prices. although we stayed away from the mainland, the lido wasn't so bad. there's some things you can do, such as rent a four-wheeler, walk to the shops and restaurants, and if you go there during good warm weather, then you can also use the beach! However, id go back to this hotel, probably just when they are busier and the weather's nice, so i could take advantage of the outdoor pool & beach!

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in Venice”
Reviews.Author: kimpharmd00
Reviews.Content: We stayed there at the end of the season, amenities looked "well worn" but that it could be a beautiful hotel in the height of the season. Rooms were old, but clean. Staying here, we felt like we were transported back in time.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat sad and disappointed :(”
Reviews.Author: pieface-cheri
Reviews.Content: Upon my arrival to the Westin Excelsior I was impressed! As my husband and I arrived in the boat taxi and I said WOW! This is great! We arrived at the front desk for check-in and the clerk (Franchesca) was very cold and stiff. We had booked the Grand Deluxe Sweet. Our luggage was taken to our room only to our dismay when we entered the room we were hit with the horrible smell of smoke! (We are non-smokers) We went back to the front desk to change our room by the very cold and stiff Franchesca was given another room. But this time it was not the deluxe room we had booked, but a smaller standard room with twin beds! We went back once again to see STIFF and COLD FRANCHESCA only to be told she had no other rooms available. We stayed 3 days and 4 nights and STIFF and COLD FRANCHESCA never changed our room. We also asked to speak to the mgr. on site and was told she was " to busy". Not sure why we were treated this way, but we were, we have a idea but I won't say. I loved the old school flavor of the hotel, the island where it is located on and I would come back (after COLD and STIFF FRANCHESCA) is gone.

Reviews.Title: “Marvellous grandeur - just watch the extras”
Reviews.Author: CovSteve
Reviews.Content: We booked this for a long weekend for our first anniversary. On arrival we got a free upgrade to a HUGE sea view room on the fifth floor and after mentioning our anniversary a complimentary bottle of bubbly and fruit basket arrived at our door (NB each room has is own doorbell - a feature I'd not seen before). Service was great at all times and the buffet breakfasts are wonderful - a huge range of cereals, fruits, breads etc. The free hourly shuttle to and from St Mark's Square is extremely useful and a feature we made regular use of. However, the price of anything not included in your room rate is a bit staggering. The minibar price list includes bottles of water at 5 Euros and small Pringles at 8.50. The restaurant/bar prices are similarly high. In the 3 days we had 4 teas/coffees between us at a cost of 21 Euros. Needless to say we ate out a lot. The quiet beach is lovely, although the sand is more like builder's sand than some of the fine white sand you might expect. The checkout time of 12:00 is a welcome change if you're used to UK checkouts of 10am. Tips: To get there, take the water taxi (Blue or Red Route) (13 Euros) from the airport to Lido and get a taxi (12 Euros) for the last mile. If arriving by train, get the water bus to St Marco and then the hotel launch from outside the Hotel Danieli (look for the Ciga Hotels sign) which goes every hour on the hour.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel, but lacks the personal touch”
Reviews.Author: Stanforddjkl
Reviews.Content: The Excelsior is world famous for being the hotel for the Venice film festival. There is wonderful oppulent feel about the hotel, grand decor, you can just see all the film stars that have graced its halls. However, it does lack that personal feel. Yes, it is big, and yes some staff are nice, but others are a bit snooty and a little 'off'. We experienced being sent from Concierge to reception and back again as their duties seem a little grey in definition. It does not help that the desks are ooposite in a big reception. However, for seeing Venice and the fact that there is a superb free complimentary taxi service to and from San Marco (and via Mureno if required) is a big bonus. We used it regularily, takes about 20 minutes and is a great freebie. The rooms are nice, I have seen better bathrooms in 5 star hotels, but they were clean and well furnished, and thge maid service was excellent. It haslo has a fabulous beach and pool (cold!!). The prices for drinks and food are way above anywhere else, it seems to be a standard thing now that hotels of this stature feel that 8 euro for a small beer is acceptable. We just accepted it, but some may not, because you can afford such a hotel does not necessarily mean you should have to pay over the odds for such items. Venice - there is no need to say what you should see, but the maxim go and get lost is a good one, do so, and you will never be bored. Just by getting 'lost' we saw all teh things we wanted to see, the Rialto Bridge, the Grand Canal and so on. It was hot, so standing in the long queues to get into the Doges or San Marco were a no-no. The Hotel taxi pick up and drop is by the Bridge of Sighs at the Starwood quay. Finally - taxis are an incrediblt expensive item. Hotel to Airport on the final day - 130 euro. Flinch..you bet!!
